result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwight Ian Allen

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dwight Ian Allen appeared by video.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey appeared by video for Dwight Ian Allen.  Attorney Ryan Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a motion hearing, final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Defense to file their motion by 11/2/22. Any response by the State is due by 11/23/22. Any reply by the defendant is due 12/9/22. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-27-2022, filed.

Defendant Dwight Ian Allen appeared by video.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey appeared by video for Dwight Ian Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel provides an update to the Court. For reasons stated on the record, Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report-9-30-2022, filed.

Defendant Dwight Ian Allen in court.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey appeared by video for Dwight Ian Allen.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Discovery issues put forth on the record. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference to Br 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8.25.2022, filed.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Dwight Ian Allen in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel requests a Status Conference date. Case adjourned to Br 29.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.26.2022
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (15 pages) commencing 06-30-2022, by Katherine LoCicero.
by Attorney Colleen Cullen, filed.

Defendant Dwight Ian Allen in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Student Intern Jessica Birmingham under the supervision of  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Scott Wieting - MPD Police Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.30.2022, filed.
of expert testimony and intent to use DNA, filed.

Defendant Dwight Ian Allen in court with attorney Katherine Graber for Colleen Cullen.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an adjournment of the preliminary hearing. State's witness was present. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5.25.2022, filed.

Defendant Dwight Ian Allen in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Schduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests a preliminary hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

received and filed.

Defendant Dwight Ian Allen in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for preliminary hearing.    Attorney Collen Cullen will be appointed pending conflict check.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision report 04-13-2022, filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.I.D. and S.M.K.

Defendant Dwight Ian Allen in court with  Student Intern Alexia Gianitsos under the supervision of attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Dwight Ian Allen in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dwight Ian Allen appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 1. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
